Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that the Gujarat Board of Education is teaching students "The advantages of the Dowry system," when in fact the paper in question is not a part of the Gujarat Education Board syllabus.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that the Gujarat Board of Education is teaching students "The advantages of the Dowry system." The provided evidence only includes a viral image and social media posts.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the inclusion of the paper in the textbook reflects the views and intentions of the Gujarat Board of Education, without providing concrete evidence to support this assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the paper in question was previously reported to be found in the sociology study material of Bangalore's St Joseph's College, not in the Gujarat Education Board syllabus.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting conflicting information regarding the origin and inclusion of the paper, as well as the involvement of the Gujarat Board of Education.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation could be that the paper was included in the textbook as an example of a controversial and oppressive view that students should be aware of and critically analyze, rather than as an endorsement of the dowry system.
